amendment.description: To improve the accuracy of mortgage underwriting used by the Federal Housing Administration by ensuring that energy costs are included in the underwriting process, to reduce the amount of energy consumed by homes, to facilitate the creation of energy efficiency retrofit and construction jobs, and for other purposes.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3202, under the order of 4/13/16, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 31. Record Vote Number: 49.

action.text: Amendment SA 3202 proposed by Senator Isakson to Amendment SA 2953. (consideration: CR S 2164, S2187-2188) To improve the accuracy of mortgage underwriting used by the Federal Housing Administration by ensuring that energy costs are included in the underwriting process, to reduce the amount of energy consumed by homes, to facilitate the creation of energy efficiency retrofit and construction jobs, and for other purposes.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 3202, under the order of 4/13/16, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 31. Record Vote Number: 49.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 3202, under the order of 4/13/16, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 31. Record Vote Number: 49.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3202 proposed by Senator Isakson to Amendment SA 2953.
